page.title: 04Colstrope Farm-Dairy.
page.content: We have 65 Friesian cows and also some young calves,yearlings and heifers.When a heifer has had its first calf,it becomes a cow and is milked with the rest of the herd twice a day.The new calf is fed on its mother's milk for 3 to 4 days.It is then put onto the bucket,but,if it will not take milk from its mother,we use an old baby bottle with the hole in the teat enlarged.The bottle is then filled with warm milk and the calf will,with a bit of coaxing,drink from the bottle. All through the winter the calves are fed on hay,straw,calf nuts and brewer's grains.We feed this mixture to the calves until they are old enough to go out into the fields.This will usually happen from mid June to late July.If a cow has mastitis,the milk cannot be accepted into the large refrigerated bulk tank for fear of contamination.
